briefdescription.para: Number of columns (from the left) to skip.
Whether the CSV file has a header.

detaileddescription.para: Column containing labels. -1 is used for the last column. The label column ignores skipped columns, and can be among columns that are skipped.

briefdescription.para: Column containing responses; functions the same as the label column.
Number of columns (including the label column and skipped columns).

detaileddescription.para: Index mapping lines (samples) to their start offset within the file. This excludes the header, but includes a final entry indicating the length of the file.

briefdescription.para: Label transform function that converts to an int.
Response transform function that converts to a DataType.

detaileddescription.para: This defaults to using the last column for the label/response.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of columns (from the left) to skip; default 0.
Set the number of rows (from the top) to skip; default 0.
Set whether the CSV file has a header; default true.

detaileddescription.para:
Supply a custom transform to convert an input string to a numerical value.
col
The column to apply this transform to; do not account for skipped columns.
f
The transform to apply.
Supply a custom transform to convert the label column to an integer. Note that the label should be an integer starting from 0.
Supply a custom transform to convert the response column to a DataType.
This parses the header of the CSV to determine column information.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of labels (classes) in this dataset.
Get the linearized size (i.e. number of elements) in a sample.
Get the linearized size (i.e. number of elements) in a label.
Get the dimensions of the data.

detaileddescription.para: Return the parsed CSV line and store the label and response in the m_labels and m_responses vectors, respectively. The label and response are not present in the vector. (Made public to support data store functionality)

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &X, int data_id, int mb_idx, int tid) override
memberdef.name: fetch_datum

detaileddescription.para: Fetch the data associated with data_id. Note this does not normalize the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &Y, int data_id, int mb_idx, int tid) override
memberdef.name: fetch_label

briefdescription.para: Fetch the label associated with data_id.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &Y, int data_id, int mb_idx, int tid) override
memberdef.name: fetch_response

briefdescription.para: Fetch the response associated with data_id.

detaileddescription.para: Return the parsed CSV line. This does not extract the label/response.
Return a raw line from the CSV file. (Made public to support data store functionality)

Data reader for CSV (and similar) files. This will parse a header to determine how many columns of data there are, and will return each row split based on a separator. This does not handle quotes or escape sequences. The label column is by default converted to an integer.
This does not currently support comments or blank lines.
